reviewText: Total crap, boring as you can get.  Thought I would give it a shot as it came in a bundle, but all you do is blow up stacks of lumber and steel, not buildings like I was expecting.  I've played older dos based demolition games with more to do than this pile of ##$%.

reviewText: This game should be only on phones. Playing this one on pc is too dam boring. 4/10

reviewText: I thought this would be similar to demolition company gold, but it's way more boring.  I couldn't even make it thru the tutorial because it is such a snorefest.

reviewText: Well this game is actually an enjoyable time waster.  It is not anything like a high end aaa release. But it is not nearly as bad as other reviews make it out to be .

reviewText:
the comcept is good and the game works quite well.

the only problem is that the result of your explosion configuration is affected by some sort of randomness (trying the same configuration multiple times will result in multiple different results), this is not a big deal with small levels, I was enjoying the game until more complicated levels came in, here there's a lot of stuff going on and due to this randomness you can't predict the result of your actions, and therefore correct your mistakes and try to improve your performace; the game become frustrating also thanks to the bad user interface. also adding a slow-mo mode to look at the demolition would be useful

too bad...I think that it can be improved very easily, but I doubt devs will do that
